Hyperglycaemia: level (HbA1c) and duration of exposure

Dyslipidemia

Associated smoking or alcoholism

Specific DRFs for certain diseases: genetic factors, ethnic origins (e.g. for nephropathy), for neuropathy: tall stature, nutritional and vitamin deficiencies, smoking and alcoholism, renal insufficiency, etc.

question.title: What is a risk factor for the onset of microangiopathic disorders in individuals with diabetes?

option_a.title: Hyperglycemia and duration of exposure
option_a.description: The level of glucose in the blood and the length of time it has been high

option_b.title: Dyslipidemia and smoking
option_b.description: Abnormal levels of lipids in the blood and a history of smoking

option_c.title: Genetic factors and tall stature
option_c.description: Inherited traits and a family history of the disease

option_d.title: Ethnic origins and nutritional deficiencies
option_d.description: The individual's ancestry and a lack of essential nutrients
